parts of the earth's surface where water exists as ice: Scientists now have much better technology, especially satellites, to study polar regions known as the cryosphere. Earth's cryosphere—its high-latitude regions of snow and ice—represents a central piece of the climate system.
More examplesFewer examplesScientists hope to achieve a better understanding of the dynamics of the various types of ice in the Antarctic cryosphere.James Lovelock presented his theory that the biosphere and physical components of the Earth - atmosphere, cryosphere, hydrosphere and lithosphere - form an interacting system. Climate change may affect the hydrological cycle, the carbon cycle, and the cryosphere among other climate elements.Scientists who are experts in the cryosphere do not agree with his comments.
